alert.note: Alert for Clark; Miami (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 9:00PM EDT until June 01 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Miami and Clark counties. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 858 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Tipp City, Grayson, New Carlisle, Haven View, North Hampton, Troy, West Milton, Northridge, Pleasant Hill, Springfield, Brown, Union, Tremont City, Donnelsville, Potsdam and Ludlow Falls.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
